issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: [Python][Packaging] Add mimalloc to conda packages for better performance

comments.body:
There is no mimalloc feedstock in Conda-forge yet, so it can take a bit longer to ship ARROW_MIMALLOC=ON with CF. 

We may postpone it after 0.15, let's see depending on the remaining issues.
mimalloc is built from source with dedicated compile options.
That is discouraged according to the CF policy https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/adding_pkgs.html#avoid-external-dependencies
Well, we're already doing it for jemalloc, right?
Hmm, seems so. Why don't we use https://github.com/conda-forge/jemalloc-feedstock? cc [~xhochy]
Because we're using specific compile options. This is by design.
Specific options is a good point. I guess that should by fine by CF too.

In the case of jemalloc, one of the main reasons is that we need for older glibc versions the latest commit on the stable-4 branch. This was never released and as conda-forge is only building releases, we couldn't have a build for it there.
